keyword: how many calories in a dill pickle
title: How Many Calories in a Dill Pickle?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a dill pickle, including full nutrition breakdown, sodium content, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Dill Pickle?
assumptions: Medium-sized (65 g) whole dill pickle, fermented in brine, no added sugars or spices beyond dill and garlic.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, brine concentration, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium dill pickle has just 12 kcal, mostly from carbs, with high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a dill pickle?
faqs.a: About 12 kcal for one medium dill pickle.

faqs.q: Is a dill pickle low calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, just 12 kcal, making it a great low-cal snack option.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in a dill pickle?
faqs.a: Around 1208 mg per medium pickle due to the brine.

faqs.q: Do dill pickles have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: 2.3 g carbs and 1 g fiber per pickle from the cucumber.

faqs.q: How does pickle size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger pickles have more (~18 kcal for extra-large); spears are lower (~6 kcal).
